name: v3.13.4
body:
This release is a patch release to reflect many dependency updates since v3.13.3. No new features are included in this release.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/compare/v3.13.3...v3.13.4

name: v3.13.3
body:
## What's Changed
*  meson.build: add unsupported_use_system_yamlcpp option by @martinetd in https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/pull/129
*  Plus a bunch of dependency updates.


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/compare/v3.13.2...v3.13.3

name: v3.13.2
body:
## What's Changed
* Fix ARM release binary build by @joshkunz in https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/pull/124
* Support linking against std::fs for older compilers by @joshkunz in https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/pull/125


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/compare/v3.13.0...v3.13.2

name: v3.13.0
body:
Features:

* Added `--exclude-from` option to allow exclusion rules to be passed in a YAML-formatted file. See the readme for more details.

name: v3.12.8
body:
Bug Fixes:

* (#112) Fixes a bug where each tag in a single `--exclude` would be considered a separate rule.

name: v3.12.7
body:
Bug Fixes:

* (#112) Now all tags passed in a single `--exclude` must match for a song to be excluded.

name: v3.12.5
body:
Features: **None**

Bug Fixes:

* Add an optimization to avoid loading song tags when no groups or filters are supplied. Partially fixes #89
* Upgrades absl and googletest dependencies

name: v3.12.3
body:
Features:

* Adds `--tweak exit-on-db-update=yes` to force ashuffle to exit when the database is updated. This allows workflows that use external commands to generate the shuffle items to re-run with each update. This is a partial work-around to issue #89.

name: v3.11.1
body:
Confused about which binary to pick? [Check the docs here.](https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle#pre-built-binaries)

Bug Fixes:

* (#96) Maintain "group by" across database reloads.

name: v3.11.0
body:
Features:

* Adds `-v`/`--version` flag.

Bug Fixes:

* Print nicer warning message when libmpdclient returns `MPD_ERROR_MALFORMED`.

name: v3.10.0
body: Re-adds RPi 0/1 (`armv6h`) support. See the binaries below for downloads.

name: v3.9.0
body: Adds `suspend-timeout` tweak. See readme.md for details.

name: v3.7.0
body: Adds `--tweak` options. See `readme.md` for details.

name: v3.6.0
body: Adds `armv6h`, `armv7h` releases. See the [release documentation](https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/blob/master/readme.md#pre-built-binaries) if you're not sure which binary to download.

name: v3.5.0: Better Randomness
body: Before this release, ashuffle used the C `rand()` family of functions to randomly pick songs to play. `rand()` is not a particularly good random number generator, and with the move to C++ we've unlocked access to better random number generators. This release switches to using a standard Mersenne Twister for generating random number rather than system `rand()`.

name: v3.4.0: Build System Update
body: This change release is functionally identical to v3.3.0, but contains build system changes to make it easier for package maintainers to package ashuffle.

name: v3.3.0: By-Album Support
body: Adds support for shuffle-by-album with the new `--by-album` flag.

name: v3.1.0: Performance fixes for `-f`
body: This release dramatically speeds up the startup time for users that combine the `-f` option with `-e` by using a more-efficient strategy for querying MPD.

name: v3.0.0: ashuffle Re-write
body: The release provides no new features, but constitutes a major re-write of ashuffle in C++. This is released as a new major version because the build is backwards incompatible.

name: v2.3.1: Binary AArch64 Release
body: Should support ARM Cortex-A53 or newer.

name: v2.2.2: Binary Release
body: This release adds an x86_64 Linux binary release for ashuffle.
This release fixes the slow-startup issue when using the `-f` option. See issue #31 for more details.

name: v2.0.1
body:
This change incorporates over 5kLOC of changes, 50+ commits, done across 9 months. This major version reflects a major internal re-write focusing on correctness and stability. The most significant change is a [comprehensive test suite](https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/tree/v2.0.0/t/readme.md), including end-to-end integration tests of ashuffle against most major MPD and libmpdclient versions. Many bugs were found and fixed as a result of this test suite. Thanks to this automated integration testing, now ashuffle also has an official MPD/libmpdclient version support policy (see [readme.md](https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/tree/v2.0.0/readme.mpd)).

Since this is a major version, this release also includes two **backwards-incompatible changes**:

* `Makefile` support has been fully removed, and `meson` is now the only supported build system. See the [getting-started](readme.md#getting-started) section for `meson` build instructions.
* The `--nocheck` flag has been re-named to `--no-check` to be consistent with the other multi-word flags.

Thanks to all ashuffle users, and enjoy version 2! If you'd like to get a notification for future major ashuffle releases, you can subscribe to the new [`announce@ashuffle.app`](https://groups.google.com/a/ashuffle.app/forum/#!forum/announce) mailing list.

name: v2.0.0
body: Please use [v2.0.1](https://github.com/joshkunz/ashuffle/releases/tag/v2.0.1) instead. This release does not build correctly. See issue #37 for details.
